title: IDF claims video shows Hamas weapons in Al-Shifa hospital
description: Israel’s military has provided video that it says shows Hamas weapons and equipment hidden inside Gaza City’s main hospital, thereby justifying IDF operations in the area. NBC News cannot independently verify the video or Israel’s claims about what was found.

title: 'Terrified and scared': Doctor describes scene inside raided Gaza hospital
description: NBC's Erin McLaughlin reports that Israeli officials now claim al-Shifa Hospital is no longer protected under international law due to the presence of an alleged Hamas command center.

title: ‘Hospitals are not battlegrounds’: WHO chief condemns Israeli raid on Al-Shifa
description: “Even if health facilities are used for military purposes, the principles of distinction and precaution and proportionality always apply,” insisted World Health Organization Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus.

title: Biden meets with Chinese President Xi Jinping
description: President Joe Biden met with Chinese President Xi Jinping for the first face-to-face conversation between the two leaders in a year. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer details why this meeting is so important for Xi and his image.

title: Man arrested in death of U.K. ice hockey player Adam Johnson released on bail
description: A man arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of manslaughter for the death of U.K. professional ice hockey player Adam Johnson was released on bail today, the South Yorkshire Police said.

title: China gains a foothold in America’s backyard with giant Peru port project
description: A Chinese-backed port project in Peru is set to transform the local and regional economy but has raised concerns from the U.S. about national security.

title: Conservative Muslims in Indonesia protest Coldplay concert over the band's LGBTQ support
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia — More than 200 conservative Muslims marched in Indonesia’s capital on Wednesday, calling for the cancellation of a Coldplay concert that night over the British band’s support for the LGBTQ community.

title: Russia says Ukrainian forces have crossed a key river but face ‘hell fire’ and death
description: Russia has conceded for the first time that some Ukrainian forces have crossed onto the Dnipro River's eastern bank, but has said they face “hell fire” and that the average life expectancy of a Ukrainian soldier there is around two days.

title: U.K.'s top court rejects plan to deport asylum seekers to Rwanda as unlawful
description: The United Kingdom's heavily-delayed and contentious plan to deport asylum seekers to the central African state of Rwanda was rejected by the British Supreme Court on Wednesday.

title: Video said to show medics in dust-filled hallways of the Al-Shifa hospital in Gaza
description: The Gaza Ministry of Health released video of what it said showed the evacuation of patients along dust-filled hallways in the Al-Shifa hospital.

title: Israeli military video said to show Hamas operations center in Gaza refugee camp
description: The Israeli army released video on Tuesday of what it said were its soldiers “dismantling Hamas centers and capabilities it had built over the years,” in Al-Shati, Gaza Strip. NBC News cannot independently verify the video.

title: Colombia starts sterilizing hippos descended from pets of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar
description: Colombia on Tuesday began the sterilization of hippopotamuses, descendants of animals illegally brought to the country by late drug kingpin Pablo Escobar in the 1980s.

title: Israel says its military is now in control of Gaza City Center
description: Israel is now saying its military has control of Gaza City Center. This comes as the largest hospital there is becoming a graveyard without power, water or basic medical supplies. Staff at al-Shifa hospital tell NBC News they buried 80 people in a mass grave. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

title: March for Israel takes place in Washington, D.C. to push for release of hostages
description: Tens of thousands of demonstrators took to Washington, D.C. for the “March for Israel” today. As the fighting rages in Gaza, the worldwide outcry on both sides has intensified. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has more details.
